page.title: 13SHOPPING IN DYKE
page.content: As there are no shops in the Dyke block local residents have to shop outwith the area.In the Parish of Dyke there is a shop at Brodie and a shop at Conicavel.Most of the shopping is done in Forres or in the larger supermarkets in Elgin or Inverness. During a week a butchers van visits twice, a bakers thrice, a grocers once and two different fish vans once each. The mobile library visits the village as does a coal lorry and a laundry van which collects by request.The postman comes by van from Forres daily as does the milkman who also delivers the daily papers to those who order them. There is a mini bus which does a double return journey on Tuesdays and Fridays and a larger bus does the same journey on Tuesdays and Saturdays.Both buses go to Forres.
